verses.verse: A Psalm of David <S%H1732><s%>. Plead <S%H7378><s%> my cause, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, with them that strive <S%H3401><s%> with me: fight <S%H3898><s%> against them that fight <S%H3898><s%> against me.
Take hold <S%H2388><s%> of shield <S%H4043><s%> and buckler <S%H6793><s%>, and stand up <S%H6965><s%> for mine help <S%H5833><s%>.

Draw out <S%H7324><s%> also the spear <S%H2595><s%>, and stop <S%H5462><s%> the way against <S%H7125><s%> them that persecute <S%H7291><s%> me: say <S%H559><s%> unto my soul <S%H5315><s%>, I am thy salvation <S%H3444><s%>.

Let them be confounded <S%H954><s%> and put to shame <S%H3637><s%> that seek <S%H1245><s%> after my soul <S%H5315><s%>: let them be turned <S%H5472><s%> back <S%H268><s%> and brought to confusion <S%H2659><s%> that devise <S%H2803><s%> my hurt <S%H7451><s%>.
Let them be as chaff <S%H4671><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%>: and let the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> chase <S%H1760><s%> them.

Let their way <S%H1870><s%> be dark <S%H2822><s%> and slippery <S%H2519><s%>: and let the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> persecute <S%H7291><s%> them. dark: Heb. darkness and slipperiness

For without cause <S%H2600><s%> have they hid <S%H2934><s%> for me their net <S%H7568><s%> in a pit <S%H7845><s%>, which without cause <S%H2600><s%> they have digged <S%H2658><s%> for my soul <S%H5315><s%>.

Let destruction <S%H7722><s%> come <S%H935><s%> upon him at unawares <S%H3045><s%> <S%H3808><s%>; and let his net <S%H7568><s%> that he hath hid <S%H2934><s%> catch <S%H3920><s%> himself: into that very destruction <S%H7722><s%> let him fall <S%H5307><s%>. at: Heb. which he knoweth not of
And my soul <S%H5315><s%> shall be joyful <S%H1523><s%> in the LORD <S%H3068><s%>: it shall rejoice <S%H7797><s%> in his salvation <S%H3444><s%>.

All my bones <S%H6106><s%> shall say <S%H559><s%>, LORD <S%H3068><s%>, who is like unto thee, which deliverest <S%H5337><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> from him that is too strong <S%H2389><s%> for him, yea, the poor <S%H6041><s%> and the needy <S%H34><s%> from him that spoileth <S%H1497><s%> him?

False <S%H2555><s%> witnesses <S%H5707><s%> did rise up <S%H6965><s%>; they laid to my charge <S%H7592><s%> things that I knew <S%H3045><s%> not. False: Heb. Witnesses of wrong they: Heb. they asked me
They rewarded <S%H7999><s%> me evil <S%H7451><s%> for good <S%H2896><s%> to the spoiling <S%H7908><s%> of my soul <S%H5315><s%>. spoiling: Heb. depriving

But as for me, when they were sick <S%H2470><s%>, my clothing <S%H3830><s%> was sackcloth <S%H8242><s%>: I humbled <S%H6031><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> with fasting <S%H6685><s%>; and my prayer <S%H8605><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> into mine own bosom <S%H2436><s%>. humbled: or, afflicted

I behaved <S%H1980><s%> myself as though he had been my friend <S%H7453><s%> or brother <S%H251><s%>: I bowed down <S%H7817><s%> heavily <S%H6937><s%>, as one that mourneth <S%H57><s%> for his mother <S%H517><s%>. behaved myself: Heb. walked as though: Heb. as a friend, as a brother to me

But in mine adversity <S%H6761><s%> they rejoiced <S%H8055><s%>, and gathered themselves together <S%H622><s%>: yea, the abjects <S%H5222><s%> gathered themselves together <S%H622><s%> against me, and I knew <S%H3045><s%> it not; they did tear <S%H7167><s%> me, and ceased <S%H1826><s%> not: adversity: Heb. halting
With hypocritical <S%H2611><s%> mockers <S%H3934><s%> in feasts <S%H4580><s%>, they gnashed <S%H2786><s%> upon me with their teeth <S%H8127><s%>.

Lord <S%H136><s%>, how long wilt thou look on <S%H7200><s%>? rescue <S%H7725><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from their destructions <S%H7722><s%>, my darling <S%H3173><s%> from the lions <S%H3715><s%>. darling: Heb. only one
I will give thee thanks <S%H3034><s%> in the great <S%H7227><s%> congregation <S%H6951><s%>: I will praise <S%H1984><s%> thee among much <S%H6099><s%> people <S%H5971><s%>. much: Heb. strong

Let not them that are mine enemies <S%H341><s%> wrongfully <S%H8267><s%> rejoice <S%H8055><s%> over me: neither let them wink <S%H7169><s%> with the eye <S%H5869><s%> that hate <S%H8130><s%> me without a cause <S%H2600><s%>. wrongfully: Heb. falsely
For they speak <S%H1696><s%> not peace <S%H7965><s%>: but they devise <S%H2803><s%> deceitful <S%H4820><s%> matters <S%H1697><s%> against them that are quiet <S%H7282><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%>.
Yea, they opened their mouth <S%H6310><s%> wide <S%H7337><s%> against me, and said <S%H559><s%>, Aha <S%H1889><s%>, aha <S%H1889><s%>, our eye <S%H5869><s%> hath seen <S%H7200><s%> it.
This thou hast seen <S%H7200><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>: keep not silence <S%H2790><s%>: O Lord <S%H136><s%>, be not far <S%H7368><s%> from me.
Stir up <S%H5782><s%> thyself, and awake <S%H6974><s%> to my judgment <S%H4941><s%>, even unto my cause <S%H7379><s%>, my God <S%H430><s%> and my Lord <S%H136><s%>.
Judge <S%H8199><s%> me, O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God <S%H430><s%>, according to thy righteousness <S%H6664><s%>; and let them not rejoice <S%H8055><s%> over me.

Let them not say <S%H559><s%> in their hearts <S%H3820><s%>, Ah <S%H1889><s%>, so would we have it <S%H5315><s%>: let them not say <S%H559><s%>, We have swallowed him up <S%H1104><s%>. Ah: Heb. Ah, ah, our soul

Let them be ashamed <S%H954><s%> and brought to confusion <S%H2659><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> that rejoice <S%H8056><s%> at mine hurt <S%H7451><s%>: let them be clothed <S%H3847><s%> with shame <S%H1322><s%> and dishonour <S%H3639><s%> that magnify <S%H1431><s%> themselves against me.

Let them shout for joy <S%H7442><s%>, and be glad <S%H8055><s%>, that favour <S%H2655><s%> my righteous cause <S%H6664><s%>: yea, let them say <S%H559><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%>, Let the LORD <S%H3068><s%> be magnified <S%H1431><s%>, which hath pleasure <S%H2655><s%> in the prosperity <S%H7965><s%> of his servant <S%H5650><s%>. righteous: Heb. righteousness
And my tongue <S%H3956><s%> shall speak <S%H1897><s%> of thy righteousness <S%H6664><s%> and of thy praise <S%H8416><s%> all the day <S%H3117><s%> long.
